t: Amazon rainforest now emitting more CO2 than it absorbs | Amazon rainforest | The Guardian
s: August 25, 2021 - Most of the emissions are caused by fires, many deliberately set to clear land for beef and soy production. But even without fires, hotter temperatures and droughts mean the south-eastern Amazon has become a source of CO2, rather than a sink.

t: The Amazon Rainforest Now Emits More Greenhouse Gases Than It Absorbs | Smithsonian
s: March 25, 2021 - Long considered to be a bulwark against climate change because of its capacity to absorb carbon dioxide, a new study suggests rising temperatures, increasing drought and rampant deforestation have likely overwhelmed the Amazon’s ability to absorb more greenhouse gases than it emits, reports ...
